name: Hotel Muguet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent two nights at the Hotel Muguet and really loved it. The room was small as expected but was very clean and comfortable. We loved the fact that it was just off the major drag but within easy walking distance to the Metro, Rue Cler, Eiffel Tower. A lot of patisseries and markets in the area for those also wanting to picnic, etc. We preferred it to the other hotel we stayed at when we returned to Paris (the Hotel St. Louis Marais). No reservations recommending this hotel!
reviews.title: Very pleased with our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for three nights in Paris. The location was wonderful--it is in a residential neighborhood, right off of Rue Cler, and there are a lot of little shops and restaurants nearby. There are a number of markets for fresh produce, meat and fish, a very good chocolate shop down the street, and a number of great boulangeries. We could not have asked for a better location.
reviews.title: Great location and price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: In addition to the immediate neighborhood, it is also within convenient walking distance to Les Invalides, the Eiffel Tower and the Rodin museum. We were also able to walk to the Louvre, the Musee D'Orsay and the Arc de Triomphe from the hotel. If you want public transportation, it is very close to the Ecole Militaire metro stop (a few blocks away).
reviews.title: Perfectly Convenient, Comfortable and Clean
Liked Hotel Muguet
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was great. It was small, but average for a European hotel. There was no mini-bar, but there was a television and safety box. The airconditioning was very good. The room was very, very clean. There was no do not disturb sign, which resulted in some confusion one time when a maid mistakenly thought we had left our room. Of course, you can always make your own.

reviews.title: excellent value
reviews.text: The people at the front desk were quite helpful, and there was internet access for our use, costing 2 euros for a half hour. We did not eat their breakfast, as it was so easy to walk down the street and buy a baguette.

reviews.title: Just what I'd hoped for in Paris...charming little hotel.
reviews.text: My son and I just returned from a five day stay at the Hotel Muguet. It was exactly what I had hoped for in Paris - small hotel in a relatively quiet street, a little out of the way yet close to everything. We opened our window to an unexpectedly wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower! We're avid walkers so could walk to the Eiffel Tower easily, to Luxembourg Gardens, the Seine, Musee D'Orsay, Les Invalides and almost all big attractions. The area was safe and the staff at the hotel were gracious at all times of the day or night when we came in. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and our room had a large and beautiful bathroom. It appeared that the entire hotel was recently renovated. While we didn't take breakfasts there, the dining area with a retractable roof was chic and its glass-topped tables gleaming.

reviews.title: no regrets, best vacation ever
reviews.text: We had a misunderstanding regarding our bill at the end of our stay but the mistake was quickly resolved to our satisfaction and apologies made. I would suggest that when booking any hotel anywhere, it's a good idea to have printed verification from email, fax etc. of room costs agreed upon. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting the experience of a real Paris neighborhood. It was also close to many good restaurants and sidewalk cafes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: Just got home - 8 nights at the Hotel Muguet. Perfection and comfort best describes this gem. The location is great for everything. I was travelling with my husband, 2 sons and my 80 year old mother-in-law, this hotel made it all work. The quiet, safe street and great rooms, I had the best sleep ever. A cafe on every corner makes eating out so easy and delicious.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel and a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: I would go back in a heart beat, no question about it. The staff and everyone in Paris were fantastic, so helpful and friendly. Just remember your manners, please and thank you (in French) go a long way.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel
Hotel Muguet - Highly Recommended!!
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights in mid August. Our room (for three) was quite good sized and included a small alcove for our daughter. The room was well done with great air conditioning, nice bathroom and very large thick towels. The staff was helpful and courteous. I peeked into some other rooms and they also looked decent sized. A lovely hotel in a good quiet location near restaurants and two metro stops. A great boulangerie patisserie nearby on Rue la motte-Picquet . No complaints at all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is perfect, in the 7th Arrondissement and near two Metropolitan stops. There are a number of restaurants and shops nearby. It is within a short walk from des Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is small but quite comfortable. The room is spacious, the bathroom clean with a shower stall. One of us found the bed hard, one perfectly fine. The staff is reserved but very helpful. When one of us had to buy for cough medicine, the staff gave directions to the nearest pharmacy, and coached us on the French vocabulary. And they were very helpful in directing us to a taxi queue when we had to get to a train station. A desktop in the lobby has full internet access and is free. The breakfast seemed expensive, but coffee is available throughout the day in the dining area and that area is available after 10:30am in case you want to bring in your own breakfast or lunch.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great value and superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hotel Muguet is quiet and peaceful while being ideally located to take in all the important sites of the 7th arrondissement (Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Rue Cler). The staff is gracious and helpful and the breakfast (although not included in the room rate) features deliciously strong coffee and omelettes made to order. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Muguet to family and friends travelling to Paris.
reviews.title: Fine accommodations in Paris 7th arrondissement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I arrived in early September to Hotel Muguet where I was greeted by a very professional staff member who was a great help during my stay. My first impression was that it was modern, clean, albeit a bit smaller than the North American standard but a bit bigger than some ideas of European standards, as I found out all through my month long trip. My room was the same, and as well it was well appointed, comfortable, and very tastefully decorated. The hotel was on a side street just off of a very "hip" district on the left bank. There were many excellent sidewalk cafes and shops in the area that were so classic Paris with that beautiful architecture. The hotel was close to many attractions (less than 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower), and a subway station was just around the corner. A jump on, jump off tour bus stop was close by. I had free access to a P.C. throughout my 3 day stay and the staff were friendly, patient, and accomodating, the day staff at the desk speaking excellent English. There was a breakfast room adjoining a garden offering a standard European breakfast at an additional cost. The price was what you should expect to pay to be close to it all. This shall be the same hotel I book on my next visit.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location = Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything we expected we got.Location,cleanliness,quiet place,nice staff,internet.near the subway,rue Cler,nice restaurants,Eiffel tower....
reviews.title: Quiet ,clean and great staff...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay, even though we didnt spend much time at the hotel we found it to be very clean and a pleasure to come back to at the end of each day. We stayed in the superior room (51) with a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was very clean and the bathroom was lovely so we were happy with our choice of room. We didnt have breakfast in the hotel as we found wonderful places to eat all within a few streets of the hotel. Overall we would most definately stay there again as it was in an ideal location to all the sights.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: I have never been to Paris before so I don't have too much to compare Hotel Muguet with - but I thought it was adorable! It is on a quiet, safe street nearby to the metro, shops,restaurants, and a comfortable walk to the Eiffel Tower. The staff was extremely helpful and very polite - always had a smile! They let us use the telephone to schedule a tour, opened the door to the elevator when our hands were full and let us store our luggage after we checked out.
reviews.title: Completely Satisfied!
great stay
reviews.text: The room was small but comfortable and very clean. I loved opening my window and letting the cool night air in. The bathroom was spotless, very very tiny. Plenty of towels that were replenished everyday. I could barely fit in the shower but I was happy to have one with hot water. The only weird thing is one day we came back to the room to take a midday nap and there are no do not disturb signs. When we told housekeeping we were in the room we received a phone call telling us to leave so they could clean our room! Oh well, at least they cleaned it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: Only bad thing is our room did not have a clock so we had no way of telling time. We were able to arrange for wake up calls but other than that we had no clue what time it was. I guess that is ok for holiday!
reviews.title: Quaint Hotel in a Quiet Neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights with family from Ireland
reviews.title: Great deal in a wonderful neighborhood
great hotel
reviews.text: Friendly staff .In great area not far from lovely cafe's and eaterys.Clean well serviced rooms. Will definately stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a perfect location, close to the subway, bus, etc. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. For a 3 star hotel and the price you can't beat it.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel Muguet is a great find for trips to Paris. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are quite small but well furnished and spotlessly clean. Lots of coat hangers! Our room was very quiet and dark at night, making for excellent sleep. Delicious omlettes for breakfast and fabulous coffee. The staff were able to make good recommendations for local restaurants.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, I kept forgetting to post this,
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While planning for our honeymoon in Paris, we came across this fantastic hotel on this site. looked at all of the reviews, starting with the negatives first, then the positives. What caught my eye on this hotel was the almost 500 reviews and 96% positive rate. However our experience was nothing short of 100% positive! From the friendly check in after a long flight, and the stress of metro during morning rush hour we were warmly greeted by the friendly staff. Check in was quick, they answered all of our questions, and even helped us practice our awful French.
reviews.title: Wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are small by American standards but the room had sufficient space for our stuff. The size was not a problem (had a double) but I also did not expect a massive room either. The room, bathroom, and shower were clean with no issues during out entire stay. I’m 6’4 and did not have any problems with the shower head or bed size. The A/C worked great and was a welcome relief after walking around all day. We slept great, with no problematic noise from the street or other guests. I did see on a few another reviews about the elevator. If you have a ton of baggage, yes the elevator is small and slow. But you’re in Paris and if you’re worried about the elevator, you might want to lighten up a bit. It when up, it when down, it worked!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel:great location, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here and were very pleased. The rooms are small but that is the European style so don't expect large rooms. The day staff was very helpful. The location is on a very quiet street but close to the Eiffel Tower and easy walking distance to the Avenue of the Champs-Elysees, the Arch de Triump, the Place de la Concorde and the Louvre. It is a very short walk to Rue Cler. There are many places to eat just around the corner. Two excellent restaurants in the area are Leo the Lion and La Billebaude. For those it is best to make a reservation starting no earlier than 8 pm. The price was very reasonable for Paris and if you arrive early there is a secure room to leave your luggage. There is a small but nice lobby if you are traveling with friends where you can hang out with some wine and snacks.
reviews.title: Nice location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked two rooms for two nights and this is our first trip to Paris, although the hotel is small but it's cozy and front desk two gentlemen were efficient and courteous.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Clean and location is convenient!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and bed were comfortable, we loved the bathtub and one of our room has a nice view of Eiffel Tower!
reviews.title: Sweet hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the location of this hotel, it's located on a quiet street but is only 5 minutes walk to rue cler and streets with lots of cafes.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean, nice price for Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked from the hotel to musee armee and Eiffel tower and it was a convenient short walk. Overall we like this hotel very much!
reviews.title: A cozy place to return to...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was such a great find. I chose this hotel based on a recommendation from the Rick Steve's Paris book. It is is a great location close to Ecole Militaire, Rue Cler and the Eiffel Tower. There are 2 metro stations within close walking distance. The hotel is small but has a nice lobby, eating area and the rooms and bathrooms are quite large for Paris. The hotel has very nice historic details and the rooms are clean and the bathrooms ultra modern with high end fixtures, tile, and towel warmers. There was even a sitting room in our room. We could see the light show at the Eiffel Tower from our window at night and the price was very affordable. I would recommend to anyone looking for a quiet place to sleep in Paris. The only drawback was that the hotel staff were not very helpful but we found this to be typical for most places in Paris.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Great View of Eiffel Tower, Convenient to Metro and Rule Cler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed At the Muguet twice now and will do so again. We have sent friends there who also loved it. It is on a quiet side street near the Eiffel Tower, the Invalides and Ecole Militaire. There are lots of good restaurants and other shops nearby. It is easy to get to any part of Paris from the nearby La Tour Maubourg Metro station. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The view of the Eiffel Tour was a plus this time, but most rooms will not have this view. However, even the courtyard rooms are very light and airy due to large windows and a large courtyard space. Although small, the rooms and bathrooms are so well designed that you don't get that cramped feeling that so many hotels in this price range in Paris would give you. We were particularly grateful to the excellent and attentive staff that recommended what to do when a transit strike came on the very day of our planned TGV trip to Bordeaux. We followed their advice, our trip went off without a problem,and we were not even delayed a minute. Thank you for rescuing our trip.
reviews.title: The perfect Parisian hotel with great location, rooms and staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for three nights and we were very happy with out choice. Our room was small, but we expected that. Our bed was large and comfortable and the room was very clean. We found the staff friendly and helpful and the location central and convenient to the metro. We will stay here again the next time we are in Paris.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel with an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at Hotel Muguet upon our arrival to Paris. Our room on the third floor was very comfortable and clean with a large bathroom. I particularly liked the rainwater showerhead! The large bed but was firm but surprisingly comfortable. The few interactions we had with staff on the front desk were always pleasant. The lobby area was cozy and charming. We enjoyed the convenient location to Rue Cler where we had breakfast each morning. It was a nice short walk to the Eiffel Tower and convenient to subway stations. We wwould definitely stay here again when when visiting Paris.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one night on our return to Paris after travelling around France. We wanted a location that was quiet and in a good area and easy to get from to the airport . The location is perfect on a quiet street but within a two block walk to the pedestrian street of Rue Cler which has all the good places to eat. Staff was friendly and helpful and there was even a computer availble for guest use in the lobby for those without their own laptops. Rooms were spotless but typical size for a Paris hotel. We had rented an apartment for 5 days at the beginning of our trip in Paris which turned out to be more expensive than Hotel Muguet! In the future we would definitely skip the apartment rental and instead use Hotel Muguet as home base.
reviews.title: Quiet Little Hotel in a great area of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Muguet in September 2009. It is a little gem (43 rooms) near Rue Cler, and within about 10-15 minutes walk of Rue Cler. It had a greehouse breakfast room and small garden courtyard. The rooms were clean with comfortable beds. We paid 20 euro extra for a "view" room. We did have a view of the Eiffel Tower, but didn't feel the extra fee was a good investment. The view was Ok and you spend little time in your room on this type of vacation anyway. The bathroom was well equipped, including a hairdryer, albeit the hairdryer was in a funky location-in a drawer in the main room. There was free internet access. Overall, a great place.
reviews.title: Gem Near Rue Cler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am still stunned that Parisan hotels can command $200 USD per night for such small rooms. However, we had a cozy and private little room at the attic level. The shower door leaked like crazy, which was the only annoying thing. Everything was reasonably well maintained and the staff was very helpful and friendly. A 3-5 min walk to Rue Cler's main street, and about 1.5 blocks to the metro. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower in approx 30 min.
reviews.title: Small but cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean rooms, newly renovated, great breakfast menu of eggs, meats, baguette, bread, very good coffee. Access to internet very handy. Very quiet street steps away from metro and Rue Clar (for splendid restaurants and food specialty shops). Book many months in advance to avoid disappointment
reviews.title: Fabulous 3 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to Hotel Muguet this past September after having had a wonderful stay there in May 2008. It was just as lovely as we remembered it. Very close to so many wonderful Parisian sights--Eiffel Tour, Champs Elysees, Invalides, Rue Cler--and very reasonably priced, we found it a perfect place to stay. The area is lovely and quite residential therefore very quiet. Catherine and her staff do everything possible to make your stay wonderful. The location and value make it a great place to stay.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel near the Eiffel Tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from spending 3 nights at the Hotel Muguet. We loved the location, being able to walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Seine to catch a river boat, and Rue Cler, with all it's great sidewalk cafe's and pastry shops. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, and there was a nice shower/tub.Internet was free, and there was also one internet station in the lobby for anyone to use.We never tried the breakfast they offered as the many pastry shops croissants and quiches just looked so much better.I would definitely stay here again.This hotel is a great value.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Muguet for 3 nights in Jan 2010. Hotel staff is multi-lingual and very friendly. I booked a single room at (Euro 106/night) and it had it's own bathroom. If I had to say something negative about the place it's the fact that the bathroom was tiny, but it served its purpose and that wouldn't be enough to discourage me from returning. (Also I believe the larger rooms had regular sized/larger bathrooms.)
reviews.title: Good, inexpensive hotel centrally located in 7th arrondisement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was available on site for a fee, but there were so many wonderful restaurants in the area, so I always ate elsewhere. It's very close to the Metro (Ecole Militaire) and within walking distance of the Champs Elysee and the Eiffel Tower (10-15 min).
reviews.title: Hard to choose a different hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009
reviews.text: I arrived very early in the morning and was informed that the room would not be ready until 2pm so keep that in mind. However, they will hold your luggage in their storage room if you wish. Fortunately, there were enough attractions within walking distance that you could keep yourself busy until the room became available.
reviews.title: Perfect place to return to after full days in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was very clean with daily cleaning service. And the best part - free wireless internet! As a solo traveler who was new to Paris, I wasn't sure what to expect, so I relied on TripAdvisor reviews to make my decision and all of the positive reviewers are correct. A really good stay at a boutique hotel and I'd definitely return in the future.
reviews.title: I heart hotel muguet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Last Summer was our first trip to France and we were somewhat obsessive about choosing a good hotel for our stay in Paris. I had actually settled on a different hotel, but it was booked up. Muguet was maybe our third choice because a couple of reviews had said the staff was somewhat aloof. Our first several encounters with the desk staff seemed to support that conclusion, but as time went on, we increasingly came to appreciate them. When we checked out and were on our way, our limo driver received a call before we had gone more than a mile - Muguet had found my credit card still in the hotel safe! We returned and were met by the head desk person (Catherine, I think) running to the limo to hand me my card, and urging us to go rather than thank her. I never had to move a muscle and the limo driver barely needed to slow down - good things when you need to drive to Charles DeGaulle airport.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel at good rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I reserved a single room that was located in the courtyard, on the first floor of Hotel Muguet. The room had free wireless, a queen size bed and a desk to work at. There is a shrank style closet and easy to use safe. There is enough space to walk around the bed; this is typical in France. The room was beautifully decorated and therefore a pleasure to spend time inside. The bathroom is nice and there is a heated towel rack and shower. The courtyard was so quiet that it was difficult to believe that I was in the city. The only drawback, I felt, was that they did not provide a tiny refrigerator. The hotel is located one block from the subway stop "La Tour Maubourg," #8 Line. It's the perfect location to base oneself and if you are into the food here, Cafe Constant (for dinner) is close by as is the Rue Cler market street. I participated in a Le Cordon Bleu class, located near the #12 Vaugirard stop. I was worried about being too far away but it only took about 20 minutes, via 3 easy to navigate subway lines, after stepping outside the hotel. I will definitely return!
reviews.title: Clean! Quiet! Location! More Clean!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When booking a hotel on the internet you're not always sure what you are going to get, so imagine our surprise when the room that we were staying in looked exactly like the room in the photos! We had a beautiful view of the eiffel tower, our rooms were impeccably cleaned (we could see our faces in the drains and taps) the fittings in the bathroom were new and the bed was comfortable. The service was always friendly and the location is awesome. We didn't try the breakfast as there was too many other places in Paris to try, but from what we saw it looked good! The free internet in the foyer as well as free wireless was also a pleasant touch.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Clean, Convienient! I would stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will def be staying here agian next time we are in Paris!!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with great service in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheers Rio and Scott
reviews.title: Great value and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Muguet for 6 nights. I’m not sure what room type we got, but we paid 140 euro/night and our room was HUGE compared to other European rooms we have stayed in. The bed was king-size (very firm mattress) and there were 2 closets, a couch, and a nice size bathroom. The room was very clean and well appointed. Catherine and her entire staff are very friendly and helpful. We did have a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower as well. Having the view of the Eiffel Tower is fun, but it also means that your room faces the street. If you’re a light sleeper and the view is not important to you, consider asking for a courtyard view as I think it would be quieter. The traffic noise is NOT horrible by any means, but there were a few times we were woken up in the night by trucks or motorcycles. We did, also, find the walls to be a bit thin. Our neighbors the last two nights left their TV on all night and we could hear it in our room, which was somewhat distracting. The breakfast is 10 euro/day each. It is cold cereal, hard-boiled eggs, meats and cheeses, a large croissant and a piece of French bread. There is also coffee, tea, and hot chocolate available. The neighborhood is fantastic and very convenient. Ecole Militaire and Latour Maubourg metro stops are both very close. We even walked to Invalides metro stop to catch the RER train to Versailles and it wasn’t that far (about a 15 minute walk).
reviews.title: We loved Hotel Muguet and the Rue Cler neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: Superb hotel, excellent value, large rooms (for the price) and staff who bent over backwards to help. The breakfast was ok but as the location is good I would save the money and venture out for it instead.
reviews.title: Superb
Try this one!
reviews.text: I loved this place! Great location to get all over the city on the Metro, many lovely restaurants, quiet side street but near everything. Room newly refurbished--clean and bright. Loved the help I got from Madame (can't recall her name); when I came in or out each day, she'd help me improve my French. Will definitely recommend this and return when I can.

reviews.title: Hotel Muguet: good value, good location
reviews.text: Good value. We had 2 rooms at the top of the hotel - one looked out on the Eiffel Tower & one on Invalides. Beds were comfortable, shower or tub (one each room) were better than average European. Safe in the room was handy.

reviews.title: Recommend this Hotel
reviews.text: I'd say skip the breakfasts for an add'l 8 Euros and go to the Rue Cler and pick up wonderful things to eat in your room (pastries, fruit, crepes, etc)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: Just back from Paris and our 3 night stay at the Hotel Muguet. It was very clean and although the rooms are small, they were very comfortable. The continental breakfast was very good and the staff was helpful overall. We would certainly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I took a vacation in Paris and had to stay at 3 different hotels due to availablilty problems. This was the last one we stayed at and was for sure the best one.
reviews.title: Great Value in a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to book far ahead of time because this one goes fast. I loved the hotel and the
reviews.title: High ranking is well deserved!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: location.
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed at Catherine Pelletier's Hotel Muguet for 12 days this month; we frequented this establishment on two previous occasions. Marvelous in every way! Friendly staff, clean, well-appointed rooms & reasonable prices. We opted for a superior room, at 195 Euros per night; this came with a small balcony with an unobstructed view of The Eiffel Tower! The location is perfect, close to the aforesaid tower, rue Cler, Les Invalides, Musee Rodin, Pont Alexandre III & the river Seine. Currently this hotel is rated 57 out of 1,893 Parisian hotels, in the top 3%: Bravo!
reviews.title: Pay no mind to the few middling reviews about this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Muguet for our honeymoon. We had a regular double room as the price was the top of our budget anyway (140euro per night) In general it's a very nice hotel with an excellent location and a good service. The room and a bathroom were quite small, but apparently that's something to be expected in every Parisian hotel. The only thing that I'd complain about is that the walls seem to be rather thin as we could hear pretty much everything from our neighbours. Overall it was a very positive experience and I would strongly recommend Hotel Muguet.
reviews.title: Perfect 25th anniversary stay in Paris

description: Hôtel Muguet takes its name from the French for lily-of-the-valley, a theme reflected in the hotel’s rustic yet refined decoration.
